rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: Near a Huge White Pillar
rooms.Description:
A marble pillar three feet in diameter extends up and down to the limits of
your vision. It is snowy white with veins of red and black. Standing near it,
a feeling of peace and friendship enters your mind.

rooms.Name: Meeting Place of the Gods
rooms.Description:
A small portion of the infinite plane of the Abyss has been set aside as
place for the gods to meet in relative peace. Besides the occupants and three
columns that reach into infinity this area is completely featureless, no
ground, no light sources, no boundaries of any kind. Movement is achieved by
pure thought, but being a mere mortal, you cannot comprehend the infinite
reaches of your surroundings and thus can only move to places and objects you
can see.

rooms.Name: Near a Huge Black Pillar
rooms.Description:
A marble pillar three feet in diameter extends up and down to the limits of
your vision. It is pitch black with veins of red and white. Being in it's
presence you feel an almost uncontrollable rage to attack everything.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: Near a Huge Red Pillar
rooms.Description:
A marble pillar three feet in diameter extends up and down to the limits of
your vision. It is deep red with veins of red and white. Standing near it you
feel compelled to reconsider every thought from all different angles.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:

because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Description:

because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: At the Limit of Human Comprehension
rooms.Description:
You are as far away from anything tangible as your mind can take you. Only
because of the presence of a god are you able to envision a location this far
from anything physical, and thus exist here.

rooms.Name: The Abyss
rooms.Description:
A bleak landscape stretches out before you, utterly featureless. The ground
beneath your feet is hard packed dull orange sand. The sky glows a pale pink
from some source beyond the horizon which you can never reach. You see no one
and hear nothing, and an intense feeling of emptiness is driving you closer
and closer to insanity.

rooms.Name: Stormy Waters
rooms.Description:
Large waves toss you around and a stiff breeze blows in to shore. Black storm
clouds move rapidly along horizon and occasionally tendrils reach out and pass
over you, causing brief moments of sheeting rain. In the distance lightning
plays among the clouds and every once in a while you see a brilliant strike on
the water's surface.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
You have to feel your way along the wall here because you cannot see
anything. As you move along suddenly there is no wall beneath your hands
and you stumble forward, but catch yourself as you fall forward onto
another stairway. Once you get your bearings you realize that the spiraling
stairway you have been following has a landing here and there is a steep
stairway leading up where you expected the north wall to be. West are the
stairs you just climbed to get here, however you cannot see to determine
what lies in the other directions. For some reason it is very drafty here,
and this time you can tell it is really wind and not just the touch of a
spirit.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
It is unnaturally dark in this portion of the stairway. Although you can
see torches just a little ways down their light cannot brighten this area.
In front of you the stairs lead into pitch blackness.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
There is a large landing here, and a wooden door on the west. It is
larger and better looking than the other door. The stairs also continue
past this door, but the torches do not and you cannot see more than a few
feet into the darkness.

Exits.Description:
This is a well built wooden door with silver runes inlaid at eye level and
a gold handle.

rooms.Name: Dalamar's Study
rooms.Description:
This room is quite spacious. There is a window on the far wall, the only
one you have seen in this tower, which provides a good view of most of the
city of Palanthas. There are several plush chairs arranged around a low
table near the left wall. On the right wall is a bookshelf containing
Dalamar's research as well as a few of the rarer magic texts and documents
concerning the structure of the black robes mages. In a glass case next to
the bookshelf are many jars of odd colored liquids, powders, and other
strange or disgusting substances. There is a second, higher table set off
to the right, covered with glass containers and tubing at one end and
stacks of papers and several jars of ink at the other end. On the floor in
the center of the room is a beautifully woven carpet and the walls of the
room are covered with paintings and tapestries.

Exits.Description:
This is a well built wooden door with silver runes inlaid at eye level and
a gold handle.

Upon close examination of the western wall you find an area that doesn't
look right. It is solid to the touch, but as you look at it from different
angles, it looks separate from the rest of the wall, as if it were very far
away. When you try to focus on the far off point where it seems like that
part of the wall is, you catch a glimpse of another room. This could
possibly be a portal to somewhere else.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
Another door is just in sight! Maybe if you're lucky it will be like the
room way at the bottom of the tower with nice comfortable couches to rest
on. Well, only one way to find out, and it's just a few stairs away.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
You are really starting to sweat now. Hopefully there will be another
door soon because with no end in sight yet, you will probably need to rest
a little before you reach the top.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
The stairs continue up, identical to the ones before. What started out a
nice easy stroll up the stairs is starting to get rather tiring, and you
can see no end to the climb.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
There is a small landing here, and a small wooden door to the east. This
is the door you have seen most of the mages come and go from, and hopefully
it will be a bit more exciting than these stairs. If you seek other
adventures, the stairway continues up as before after the landing.

Exits.Description: A plain wooden door with a brass handle.

rooms.Name: The Apprentice Quarters
rooms.Description:
This room is a combination warehouse, library, and bedroom. It houses the
apprentice mages and also serves as their place of study. Along the far
wall are several bookshelves filled with all sorts of books on magic, and a
few shelves with jars of different colored powders, plant clippings, and
small animal parts. On the right are beds, bunked three high, and on the
left are large desks set into alcoves in the wall.

Exits.Description: A plain wooden door with a brass handle.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
You can see a door now, just a little farther around and you will be
standing before it. Whatever is inside, it is bound to be more interesting
than your current trek up the stairs.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
As you continue to climb, you feel a very light brushing of something
against your arms and face, and you hear faint whispers. It might just be a
draft from below, after all this is a large, tall, circular, enclose area.
Yeah, that must be it, a draft.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
You continue to make your way slowly along the stairway. Although the
torches are at the same interval here as they are lower, it seems
inexplicably darker. The mages that pass you seem to pay just as much
attention to it as they do to you though, so it seems safe enough.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
The stairway continues on in the same fashion, hugging the wall in a wide
circle. Torches light your way at regular intervals, and every now and then
you see mages come out of a room higher up and and make their way up the
stairway or toward you.

rooms.Name: A Spiraling Stairway
rooms.Description:
This is the beginning of a long spiraling staircase, the top of which you
cannot see from here. It, like all the walls and floors of the tower, is
made of stone. The center is open, with the lower hall below, but the steps
are wide enough that any competent person would never accidentally fall off
the side of the stairs.

rooms.Name: The Lower Hall
rooms.Description:
This is a large circular room, in the center of the ground floor of the
tower. Expensive furniture lines the far wall, and food is laid out on a
table. Every now and then a mage comes down from the spiraling staircase to
check on the room. The mages all motion to the food and furniture as they
go about their business, but other than that they ignore you.

Exits.Description:
Huge, iron bound, wooden doors lead out of the tower, but they lack any
lock or bolt.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This food has been sitting here since before you entered, yet it looks
fresh and warm, and the drink is cool and refreshing. The scent draws you
toward the table and the food seems to be begging you to be eaten.

Large, velvet covered couches with many soft pillows beckon you to lie down
and maybe take just a short nap.

rooms.Name: Before the Tower of High Sorcery
rooms.Description:
The tower stand before you, black and ominous. Large wooden double doors
lead inside. The ground before the doors is stable and the assault of
guardians seems to have stopped for now, but looking back you see spectral
eyes watching your every move. The doors aren't locked, surprising
considering the extreme security measures you've seen so far.

Exits.Description:
Huge, iron bound, wooden doors seal the tower, but the absence of any lock
seems very strange.

rooms.Name: A Path Leading to the Tower of High Sorcery
rooms.Description:
You are almost to the tower now, however the ground here is definitely
churning as if there were things moving underneath it. Here and there you see
what look like bones stick out of the ground a little and then disappear.
Tendrils of mist swirl about you, brushing against your flesh.

rooms.Name: A Path Leading to the Tower of High Sorcery
rooms.Description:
A soft dirt path leads from the grove to the tower. It is always dark here
because of the magic of the grove and the tower. With nothing to block your
way it should be no problem to walk the rest of the way to the tower, even in
the dark. Wait a minute, was that just a trick of the shadows or did the
ground in front of you shift a little...

Exits.Description:
This leads away from the tower through Shoikan Grove. Although it may be
the fastest way out from here, any other way out would be safer.

rooms.Name: Shoikan grove
rooms.Description:
AHHHHH!!!
   AAHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!
      AAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!
As you enter the grove the fear shatters your soul, and leaves you
quivering and prone on the ground, if you're one of the lucky few who
survive that is. You had better move quick because the danger in your mind
isn't the only one. Bony hands start to grab you and pull you down into the
earth, so you may join their ranks.

Exits.Description:
A large iron gate hangs slightly off it's hinges. At one time it was
locked, but the chain has rusted through and the lock lies on the ground.

rooms.Name: A Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
This is a narrow area between the backs of the buildings and the city
walls. Because the walls are so close together and quite high, very little
light gets in here. Junk is piled all over, and people peak out at you with
suspicious looks every once in a while.

rooms.Name: Palanthas Weapons Dealer
rooms.Description:
There are so many blades and points in here it gives you the creeps. Swords,
spears, daggers, and more exotic weapons take up every inch of wall space. A
man with a patch over one eye sits at a table sharpening a long sword.

rooms.Name: Main Street
rooms.Description:
A wide cobblestone street runs north and south through the entire city.
People are bustling here and there going about their own business, bumping
into each other and you. The sound of vendors calling and people bargaining
and the smell of fresh fruit and bread permeates the air.

Exits.Description:
Huge iron gates anchored into a massive stone wall, designed to keep out an
invasion if necessary.

rooms.Name: Palanthas General Store
rooms.Description:
A small man looks you up and down as you enter. He seems to be quickly
examining and evaluating everything you own. On one shelf behind him are all
the normal adventuring supplies, rations, water containers, backpacks, etc,
and on another shelf are many strange items.

rooms.Name: The Temple of Paladine
rooms.Description:
Wide stone steps lead into the temple which has no door. The entire temple is
made from large blocks and pillars of white stone. In the center of the floor
is a large seal depicting a platinum dragon. Benches line the side walls
except for one area where copies of all the holy writings of Paladine are
stored on a shelf. Near the far wall is large stone altar, and a man in white
robes stands behind it.

rooms.Name: A Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
This is a narrow area between the backs of the buildings and the city
walls. Because the walls are so close together and quite high, very little
light gets in here. Junk is piled all over, and people peak out at you with
suspicious looks every once in a while.

rooms.Name: Palanthas Magic Shop
rooms.Description:
A robed woman fixes her eyes on you as soon as you enter, and watches your
every move closely. Glass cases display all manner of wands, books, and spell
components, as well as a few rarer magical items. You can tell the value of
the items by the intensity of the woman's gaze as you examine them.

rooms.Name: Main Street
rooms.Description:
A wide cobblestone street runs north and south through the entire city.
People are bustling here and there going about their own business, bumping
into each other and you. The sound of vendors calling and people bargaining
and the smell of fresh fruit and bread permeates the air.

rooms.Name: Palanthas Armory
rooms.Description:
A gruff man looks up at you from his work repairing armor. Shields and armor
of all sorts hang on the walls and are piled here and there on the floor near
the wall. Dented and split pieces are piled behind a counter next to several
hammers and leather working tools.

rooms.Name: Temple Grove
rooms.Description:
Small stone paths weave their way through well groomed grass to benches under
large trees where people can rest and relax. A wide path runs down the middle
up to the steps of the temple. There are only a few people around here, and
they are all quite considerate. It is a welcome break from the bustle of the
main city.

rooms.Name: Merchants Lane
rooms.Description:
This street is made of packed gravel. Although it's name suggests that it
might once have been the main market area of the city, there are very few
merchants here. Most of them seem to have set up shop on main street. The
vendors on this street look rather shady, and here and there people are
involved secretive talks.

rooms.Name: Merchants Lane
rooms.Description:
This street is made of packed gravel. Although it's name suggests that it
might once have been the main market area of the city, there are very few
merchants here. Most of them seem to have set up shop on main street. The
vendors on this street look rather shady, and here and there people are
involved secretive talks.

rooms.Name: Palanthas Central Square
rooms.Description:
Here several of the most traveled streets of Palanthas come together in a
large, open square. Cobblestones are laid out in patterns on the ground and
a few little children are trying to follow the patterns without stepping
off. In the center of the square is a fountain surrounded by benches which
are filled mainly with young couples and elderly people. There are as many
people bustling about as on main street, but they seem to have a friendlier
attitude here.

rooms.Name: Noble Way
rooms.Description:
This street runs through the rich part of town. It is paved in bricks of
various shades of red that form a mosaic of a dragon. You feel as if you
shouldn't walk on the street because it's a work of art, but the buildings
on the left side are all beautiful mansions and you feel intimidated
walking too close to them. On the right, near the end of the street is the
temple of Paladine, equally intimidating since you do not know any of the
strange gods on this world.

Exits.Description: Highly polished bronze double doors.

rooms.Name: Noble Way
rooms.Description:
This street runs through the rich part of town. It is paved in bricks of
various shades of red that form a mosaic of a dragon. You feel as if you
shouldn't walk on the street because it's a work of art, but the buildings
on the left side are all beautiful mansions and you feel intimidated
walking too close to them. On the right, near the end of the street is the
temple of Paladine, equally intimidating since you do not know any of the
strange gods on this world.

Exits.Description: A sturdy, iron-bound, oak door.

rooms.Name: Astinus' Study
rooms.Description:
In the middle of this room is a large desk with several blank books piled
neatly on it, several writing quills, several vials of ink, and a small
dish of white sand to cover mistakes with. Behind the desk sits Astinus,
the ageless scribe who knows and records everything that happens on the
world. Some say he is Gilean himself, others say that he is just a normal
human, kept alive by Gilean's blessing. Whatever the case, everyone
respects him. During the entire course of history few have ever dared to
disturb him. Every now and then an acolyte steps in to take the new books
to be shelved, other than that there is no activity in this room, and
neither the acolytes nor Astinus pay any attention to you.

Exits.Description:
This is a large oak door with a likeness of Gilean, the god of knowledge,
carved into it. It has been stained to give the carving a more lifelike
appearance. A plain bronze handle pulls the door open on totally silent
hinges.

rooms.Name: The Great Library of Palanthas
rooms.Description:
The biggest library you have every seen stretches out before your eyes.
Rows of books lead to more rows of books and yet more rows of books, on and
on like a forest of knowledge. Acolytes in plain brown robes walk calmly
about in utter silence, taking the books from the tables after people are
done with them and reshelving them. The loudest sound is that of your
footsteps. Straight ahead, past dozens of bookshelves, is a large wooden
door with a likeness of Gilean, god of knowledge, carved into it.

Exits.Description:
This is a large oak door with a likeness of Gilean, the god of knowledge,
carved into it. It has been stained to give the carving a more lifelike
appearance. A plain bronze handle pulls the door open on totally silent
hinges.

rooms.Name: Main Street
rooms.Description:
A wide cobblestone street runs north and south through the entire city.
People are bustling here and there going about their own business, bumping
into each other and you. The sound of vendors calling and people bargaining
and the smell of fresh fruit and bread permeates the air.

rooms.Name: A Noble's House
rooms.Description:
Great archways, stained glass windows, and large oil paintings are all over
this house. As you look around you cannot find one thing that doesn't appear
to be the most expensive of it's kind. The owner obviously has no qualms about
spending his cash wildly. The house is almost as big as a small castle. It is
always bright and colorful inside because of the stained glass windows and the
many large chandeliers hanging from the vaulted ceilings.

Exits.Description: Highly polished bronze double doors.

rooms.Name: A Noble's House
rooms.Description:
Lining the walls of this house are all manner of weapons and armor, and flags
from every country. Great fire places keep each room warm and medals of valor
are displayed along side land deeds and small trinkets on top of the
mantelpieces. The owner of this house must be a well decorated and rewarded
war hero. While it is not extravagant, it is considerably more spacious and
comfortable than the average house.

Exits.Description: A sturdy, iron-bound, oak door.

rooms.Name: A Large Holding Cell
rooms.Description:
This is a large square cell. The north west and south walls are made of
stone, and the east wall is made of metal bars. High up on the west wall is
a barred window. Hard mattresses covered with dirty sheets are laid out
along the walls. This place is full of people who have committed some kind
of small crime during the day. A few sit around sadly, but most of them
move all about, jabbering and having a great time. This is because most of
them are kender, and while they don't find this place especially
interesting, they always seem to find fun in any situation. It is
interesting to watch them for a while, but starts to get annoying quickly,
especially once you realize that you seem to be missing several items.

Exits.Description: A gate made of iron bars with a sturdy iron lock built into it.

rooms.Name: Palanthas Jail
rooms.Description:
The jail is not much more than a medium sized, rectangular, stone
building. This room is rather small, with a desk and chair for the head
jailor to keep track of the comings and goings of prisoners in a large
book, and just enough space for several other guards to stand around and
keep an eye on (berate) the prisoners. Most of the building is taken up by
a large holding cell where those arrested are kept until nightfall when
they are released or moved elsewhere for punishment.

Exits.Description: A gate made of iron bars with a sturdy iron lock built into it.

rooms.Name: Main Street
rooms.Description:
A wide cobblestone street runs north and south through the entire city.
People are bustling here and there going about their own business, bumping
into each other and you. The sound of vendors calling and people bargaining
and the smell of fresh fruit and bread permeates the air.

rooms.Name: A Lonely Side Street
rooms.Description:
A narrow street runs along a high stone wall on the north. Although it is
close to the docks, few people wander down here, and the ones that do
either make their homes here or seem to be lost and leave right away. Piles
of garbage and makeshift lean-to's line the wall. The street is very dirty
and smells of rotten fish and garbage.

rooms.Name: A Totally Deserted Alley
rooms.Description:
This is a small alley between the backs of buildings and a high stone
wall to the north. You can just see the top of a dark tower over the wall.
There is no one around and dust covers the street. Even the usual vermin
are strangely absent. At the end of the alley there is an opening in the
wall closed off by a large iron gate. Looking that way sends chills down
your spine and you begin to understand why this place is deserted. Just
past the gate is the beginning of a grove of trees but you cannot see into
the grove because of a strange darkness.

Exits.Description:
A large iron gate hangs slightly off it's hinges. At one time it was
locked, but the chain has rusted through and the lock lies on the ground.

rooms.Name: The Docks
rooms.Description:
Long peers stretch out to meet the large sailing vessels that arrive at a
steady pace all day. Strong men scurry about among the ships, loading and
unloading cargo, checking inventories, and making and receiving payments.
Groups of people gather on one dock where passenger vessels arrive every
hour. The dock master with the help of several guards watch over all the
activity to make sure that there are no illegal transactions going on, or
at least that they get their share of the profit.

rooms.Name: The Gates of Palanthas
rooms.Description:
Here is the entrance to the great port city of Palanthas. Home to the one of
the most powerful wizards in the world and previously to the most powerful
wizard of all time, well guarded by the Knights of Solamnia, large and
prosperous, it is, if not the most important, certainly the most recognized
city.

Exits.Description:
Huge iron gates anchored into a massive stone wall, designed to keep out an
invasion if necessary.

rooms.Name: A Well Traveled Dirt Road
rooms.Description:
Here is northern end of the road between Palanthas and the High Clerist
Tower. You can just barely hear the noise from the market here and can clearly
see the gates of the city just ahead.

rooms.Name: A Road in Disrepair
rooms.Description:
The used to be a road almost as nice as the one between Palanthas and the
High Clerist Tower, but it has not been used in ages and is now so overgrown
with weeds that it is barely distinguishable from the plains it travels
through.

rooms.Name: A Road in Disrepair
rooms.Description:
The used to be a road almost as nice as the one between Palanthas and the
High Clerist Tower, but it has not been used in ages and is now so overgrown
with weeds that it is barely distinguishable from the plains it travels
through.

rooms.Name: Traveling the Northern Plains of Ansalon
rooms.Description:
Vast plains stretch out as far north and east and west as you can see. To the
south the Khalkist Mountains loom. There are no roads or trails through here,
but by keeping the mountains on either your left or right, you can travel east
to the sea or west to civilization.

rooms.Name: Traveling the Northern Plains of Ansalon
rooms.Description:
Vast plains stretch out as far north and east and west as you can see. To the
south the Khalkist Mountains loom. There are no roads or trails through here,
but by keeping the mountains on either your left or right, you can travel east
to the sea or west to civilization.

rooms.Name: Along the Coast
rooms.Description:
A very stiff breeze blows in from the Blood Sea of Istar, which is always
covered in dark storm clouds. The sand along the shore is clay colored from
the red tinged water lapping over it. There is not really much to see here, or
any reason to be here, but maybe there will be something of interest further
down the coast.

rooms.Name: Along the Coast
rooms.Description:
A very stiff breeze blows in from the Blood Sea of Istar, which is always
covered in dark storm clouds. The sand along the shore is clay colored from
the red tinged water lapping over it. There is not really much to see here, or
any reason to be here, but maybe there will be something of interest further
down the coast.

rooms.Name: Along the Coast
rooms.Description:
A very stiff breeze blows in from the Blood Sea of Istar, which is always
covered in dark storm clouds. The sand along the shore is clay colored from
the red tinged water lapping over it. There is not really much to see here, or
any reason to be here, but maybe there will be something of interest further
down the coast.

rooms.Name: A Path Around Kendermore
rooms.Description:
Although there has been little to guide you up until now, here is a well
defined path. It is the last refuge for a traveler who has come upon Kenermore
unexpectedly and wishes to pass through the area without entering the city.

rooms.Name: A Path Around Kendermore
rooms.Description:
This is a foot path, not all that large, but well traveled. The brush near
the path and between the path and Kendermore has been cut away so that any
approaching kender may be spotted well in advance.

rooms.Name: A Path Around Kendermore
rooms.Description:
This is a foot path, not all that large, but well traveled. The brush near
the path and between the path and Kendermore has been cut away so that any
approaching kender may be spotted well in advance.

rooms.Name: A Path Around Kendermore
rooms.Description:
This is a foot path, not all that large, but well traveled. The brush near
the path and between the path and Kendermore has been cut away so that any
approaching kender may be spotted well in advance.

rooms.Name: A Path Around Kendermore
rooms.Description:
Although there has been little to guide you up until now, here is a well
defined path. It is the last refuge for a traveler who has come upon Kenermore
unexpectedly and wishes to pass through the area without entering the city.

rooms.Name: Traveling Through the Khalkist Mountains
rooms.Description:
The going is very rough through these mountains. The ground is covered in
loose rocks and very slippery and there are drop offs all over. Most of the
time the easiest path is blocked by boulders and debris, and often the only
choice is clambering up an 80 degree incline. Out of caves and from behind
rocks you think you catch movement and it feels like something is watching
you. Faint sounds echo in the valleys, to indistinct to make out.

rooms.Name: Traveling Through the Khalkist Mountains
rooms.Description:
The going is very rough through these mountains. The ground is covered in
loose rocks and very slippery and there are drop offs all over. Most of the
time the easiest path is blocked by boulders and debris, and often the only
choice is clambering up an 80 degree incline. Out of caves and from behind
rocks you think you catch movement and it feels like something is watching
you. Faint sounds echo in the valleys, to indistinct to make out.

rooms.Name: In a Forest
rooms.Description:
Trees and brush are thick all around you. There are no signs of civilization
around, and by the size of the trees, this forest must have been undisturbed
for a long time. The sounds of wild animals come from all around, some
pleasant and some violent.

rooms.Name: In a Forest
rooms.Description:
Trees and brush are thick all around you. There are no signs of civilization
around, and by the size of the trees, this forest must have been undisturbed
for a long time. The sounds of wild animals come from all around, some
pleasant and some violent.

rooms.Name: Through a Mountain Pass
rooms.Description:
A little traveled path leads through the mountain pass and down into the
wilderness. The ground is mostly loose rocks and there are many steep slopes.
In some places boulders block the way. The going is rough, but at least it's
better than traveling right over the mountains. As you travel along the sparse
brush gets denser and is then joined by trees.

rooms.Name: A Well Traveled Dirt Road
rooms.Description:
Here is southern end of the road between Palanthas and the High Clerist
Tower. In the middle of the mountain pass, just off the road, the tower keeps
watch, protecting the northern lands. The road continues south out of the
pass, but it is more of a trail than a road after this point.

rooms.Name: A Well Traveled Dirt Road
rooms.Description:
The road is made of packed earth and wide enough for several wagons to travel
down it at the same time. Grooves on each side of the road indicate that is is
well traveled. It goes north toward the shore and south through a mountain
pass. People pass by you in the opposite direction often and occasionally a
horse rider or carriage overtakes and passes you.

rooms.Name: Traveling the Plains of Southern Ansalon
rooms.Description:
You are in a sea of tall grass with rolling hills as far as you can see. A
gentle breeze makes the grass sway in an almost hypnotic fashion. Birds fly
overhead, and occasionally small animals scurry out of your way.

rooms.Name: Traveling the Plains of Southern Ansalon
rooms.Description:
You are in a sea of tall grass with rolling hills as far as you can see. A
gentle breeze makes the grass sway in an almost hypnotic fashion. Birds fly
overhead, and occasionally small animals scurry out of your way.

rooms.Name: Traveling the Plains of Southern Ansalon
rooms.Description:
You are in a sea of tall grass with rolling hills as far as you can see. A
gentle breeze makes the grass sway in an almost hypnotic fashion. Birds fly
overhead, and occasionally small animals scurry out of your way.

rooms.Name: A Lightly Wooded Area
rooms.Description:
There are more trees and brush here than on the plains. It's certainly no
forest, but it does make traveling a little more difficult, as well as a
little more interesting. It is pretty hilly in this area as well.

rooms.Name: A Lightly Wooded Area
rooms.Description:
There are more trees and brush here than on the plains. It's certainly no
forest, but it does make traveling a little more difficult, as well as a
little more interesting. It is pretty hilly in this area as well.

rooms.Name: A Lightly Wooded Area
rooms.Description:
There are more trees and brush here than on the plains. It's certainly no
forest, but it does make traveling a little more difficult, as well as a
little more interesting. It is pretty hilly in this area as well.

rooms.Name: A Lightly Wooded Area
rooms.Description:
There are more trees and brush here than on the plains. It's certainly no
forest, but it does make traveling a little more difficult, as well as a
little more interesting. It is pretty hilly in this area as well.

rooms.Name: A Lightly Wooded Area
rooms.Description:
There are more trees and brush here than on the plains. It's certainly no
forest, but it does make traveling a little more difficult, as well as a
little more interesting. It is pretty hilly in this area as well.

rooms.Name: A Collapsed Room
rooms.Description:
The ceiling has caved in here burying whatever may have remained after
the fire. The room itself is fairly large, and it looks like there was a
fireplace on the north wall. There is almost no trace of soot in here,
having been washed clean by the rain, however, it is not much more pleasant
than the rest of the keep since maneuvering through the ruble is quite
difficult.

rooms.Name: The Throne Room
rooms.Description:
This was once the throne room of the master of the keep, and looks to be
still in use. The walls, floor, and ceiling are chipped and crumbling from
intense head and possibly an explosion. There are no piles of ash like
there have been in other places, everything was probably vaporized rather
than just burned. In the center of the room, standing out in great contrast
to the blackness all around, is a throne made of polished human bones.

rooms.Name: The Blood Sea of Istar
rooms.Description:
Dark storm clouds roll above your head, wind buffets you and it rains on and
off in heavy downpours. The water is very choppy and a strong current flows in
a circular pattern around the center of the sea. The water is tinged red, and
has the appearance of blood because of the little amount of light that gets
through the clouds. This is the sea created when the great mountain of fire
fell on Istar ages ago, taking it right off the map. This sea, like the city
once existed here, is believed to be cursed.

Exits.Description:
At the center of the sea is a gigantic whirlpool, visible from miles away, even
with the huge waves from the strong winds that are blowing there. Even the
clouds above the whirlpool move in a rapid spiral.

rooms.Name: The Blood Sea of Istar
rooms.Description:
Dark storm clouds roll above your head, wind buffets you and it rains on and
off in heavy downpours. The water is very choppy and a strong current flows in
a circular pattern around the center of the sea. The water is tinged red, and
has the appearance of blood because of the little amount of light that gets
through the clouds. This is the sea created when the great mountain of fire
fell on Istar ages ago, taking it right off the map. This sea, like the city
once existed here, is believed to be cursed.

Exits.Description:

with the huge waves from the strong winds that are blowing there. Even the
clouds above the whirlpool move in a rapid spiral.

rooms.Description:

off in heavy downpours. The water is very choppy and a strong current flows in

clouds above the whirlpool move in a rapid spiral.

rooms.Description:

has the appearance of blood because of the little amount of light that gets

fell on Istar ages ago, taking it right off the map. This sea, like the city
