Exits.Description:
At the center of the sea is a gigantic whirlpool, visible from miles away, even
with the huge waves from the strong winds that are blowing there. Even the
clouds above the whirlpool move in a rapid spiral.

rooms.Name: Stormy Waters
rooms.Description:
Large waves toss you around and a stiff breeze blows in to shore. Black storm
clouds move rapidly along horizon and occasionally tendrils reach out and pass
over you, causing brief moments of sheeting rain. In the distance lightning
plays among the clouds and every once in a while you see a brilliant strike on
the water's surface.

rooms.Name: The Maelstrom
rooms.Description:
You are sucked into the largest whirlpool that has ever been reported, with a
force so strong that no mortal creature could ever keep from being sucked
down. Down down down, your lungs burning. Around and around in violent
circles. Your vision begins to fade and just before you lose consciousness you
think you see strange aquatic elves...

rooms.Name: A Richly Decorated Hallway
rooms.Description:
A red carpet with gold lining runs down the middle of the hallway. The
walls are lined with decorative armor and tapestries depicting battle
scenes. A stairway, also covered with red carpet, leads down to the first
floor of the tower.

rooms.Name: A Richly Decorated Hallway
rooms.Description:
A red carpet with gold lining runs down the middle of the hallway. The
walls are lined with decorative armor and tapestries depicting battle
scenes. Double door hang open allowing a restricted view of what seems to
be a counsel room beyond.

rooms.Name: The High Counsel Chambers
rooms.Description:
This room is not all that big, intended only for use of the high counsel
and the few people who come before them at a time. A large mahogany desk
fills most of the room behind which sit the counsel members. Maps of the
realms are spread over it and plans are drawn on them, in preparation for
a battle. The walls are covered in tapestries except for a window in the
wall behind the counsel.

rooms.Name: A Red Void
rooms.Description:
You fall into the part in the ocean. All around you is a bright red glow
and unbearable heat. After a few moments of falling there is no water
around you anymore. Far below you can see a small patch of land, but it is
moving toward you much slower than you are falling. Eventually the ground
meets you and you find yourself standing on baked, cracked clay. The sky
is bright red, but there is no source of light. As far as you can see in
every direction the ground and sky are featureless and unvarying. A light
breeze blows but it feels like flames on your skin. The air is hard to
breathe and you feel like you might pass out.

rooms.Name: The Abyss, Near Chaos
rooms.Description:
The ground is baked, cracked clay. The sky is bright red, but there is
no source of light. As far as you can see in every direction the ground
and sky are featureless and unvarying. A light breeze blows but it feels
like flames on your skin. The air is hard to breathe and you feel like you
might pass out. To the north there is something red, brighter than the
sky, just above the ground.

rooms.Name: A Glazed Over Beach
rooms.Description:
As you step onto the beach, it crunches beneath your feet. The top of
the sand has been melted and formed a thin layer of natural glass all over
the beach. It is very hot on this island, but still tolerable, certainly
not anywhere near hot enough to melt sand. Looking inland, everything you
can see is devastated by fire.

rooms.Name: A Charred Forest
rooms.Description:
It appears that at one time this island was mostly covered by a forest,
but as far as you can see it is all burnt. The ground is spongy with
inches of ash and coals. All the trees are burnt and fallen, making travel
very difficult. Even though there is little shelter and you are still near
the shore, there is virtually no breeze here, and the heat from the sun is
stifling. To the north you can make out a clearing, but the way is blocked
by fallen trees.

rooms.Name: A Charred Forest
rooms.Description:
The destruction is just as bad here as it is in the other parts of the
forest, giving no indication as to where the destruction came from. Here
and there small swirls of smoke seep through the ash. Your passing is
clearly visible by the tracks in the ash and haze in the air from soot
thrown up by your passing. Other than your own tracks, there is no sign of
life. The going is very rough, but you can pick a way through to the
clearing to the north from here.

rooms.Name: An Empty Clearing
rooms.Description:
There is a large clearing in the forest here. A thin layer of ash,
formerly grass, coats the clearing. There is absolutely nothing here, no
tree stumps, no large rocks, no animals or birds. The sun beats straight
down on the black ground, heating the clearing to well above one hundred
degrees. The air is so hot that it distorts you view of the forest just a
few yards away. On all sides of the clearing but the east are charred and
fallen trees. The clearing extends to the east and there appears to have
been some buildings there. The devastation is so great everywhere you can
see that there is still no indication of a source.

rooms.Name: A Gutted Village
rooms.Description:
There are rows of foundations scattered about the clearing, but nothing
else remains of the buildings. It looks like this was once a small village
by the layout of the foundations. Near some of the buildings lie charred
fragments recognizable as walls, but there is not enough left of anything
to indicate anything about the people who lived here. As you walk by the
foundations, you notice that most of the stones that made them up are
cracked from heat.

rooms.Name: A Gutted Village
rooms.Description:
This is the northern edge of the destroyed village. There is a metal
fountain in the center, slightly melted, and of course, completely dried
up. It looks like this was the meeting place for the town. All around the
fountain are bones, the only remnants of the unfortunate population of
this island.

rooms.Name: The Remnants of a Path
rooms.Description:
It seems as if there was once a wide trail here as the ground is free
from stumps along a path. Many trees have fallen into the path, making
travel almost as difficult as in the forest, but the former trail is easy
enough to keep sight of to follow.

rooms.Name: The Remnants of a Path
rooms.Description:
The path curves around a large hill here. All around you are burnt trees
and a thick layer of ash. Everything you've seen all over the island has
been totally, and evenly destroyed. It is as if a god reached down with a
fiery hand and ground the island into the planet.

rooms.Name: The End of the Path
rooms.Description:
The path comes to an end here. Before you are seven huge pine trees
arranged in a circle. They are charred, their branches withered, but yet
they still stand, guardians to whatever lies within their circle.

rooms.Name: Within The Grove
rooms.Description:
Even in their pitiful state, the pine trees still shelter and protect
this grove, huddled close around it, sheltering it with their withered
limbs. In the center of the grove are the remains of an alter. All that is
left are burnt fragments of wood. Although shattered and burned, the alter
is in better shape than anything else you have seen on this island, on
some pieces, runes are still visible.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
A small shrine to Takhisis is set up here. In an alcove in the north
wall is a gold statue of a five-headed dragon. There is a small hole in
the back of the dragon for burning incense, and it causes smoke to come
out of the dragon's heads. Above the alcove hangs a tapestry depicting a
death lily, the symbol of the Knights of Takhisis.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
You reach a small landing where the stairs end. The runes the lit the
way up the stairs also cover the ceiling here. There is nothing
interesting here, however a passage leads west into a larger room.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
You are in a large hall,that stretches from the north end of the tower
to the south. Along the west wall are bookshelves containing volumes on
strategy, magic, and a few ancient and prized books on how to mix magic
with traditional military battle. A long table fills most of this end of
the room. Chairs are placed around it at regular intervals. On the table
are several open books, a few pieces of parchment, and a few inkwells and
quills.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
You are in a large hall,that stretches from the north end of the tower
to the south. Along the west wall are bookshelves containing volumes on
strategy, magic, and a few ancient and prized books on how to mix magic
with traditional military battle. A long table fills most of this end of
the room. Chairs are placed around it at regular intervals. On the table
are several open books, a few pieces of parchment, and a few inkwells and
quills.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
A small niche in the wall here serves as a landing for a narrow
stairway. It is dark here, but there is a soft glow coming from above. The
glow carries with it a sense of power, and the shadows it casts shift in
almost lifelike motion.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This room is little more than an indentation in the wall of the next
room. The entire room is made of seamless gray stone. Two guards in robes
that match the stone stand perfectly still and silent. Narrow stairs lead
back down the tower. A soft glow emanates from the room beyond, but no
source is visible. As you stand here, the shadows cast by the glow seem to
swim about your head and whisper in your ears, but as soon as you turn to
look, they're gone.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This room is made entirely of gray stone, and is unadorned. No seams are
visible anywhere in the stone. The room is well lighted, but no source is
discernible. It extends to the south, where things look a little more
interesting.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
There are a few chairs along the south wall here. An open door on the
east wall leads to a small chamber. Two guards in gray robes stand at the
door. Now that you've had a chance to examine your surroundings, you
realize that the light here is actually coming from the air itself.

rooms.Name: Inside the Western Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This room is darker than the last, but is still lit by the air. A desk
sits in the middle of the room, facing the door. On the desk is a neat
stack of paper, with a quill and gold inkwell resting next to it. Behind
the desk are several shelves, the content of which you cannot make out. By
the mixed aromas in the room, you guess they are spell components.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
All types of armor and shields are piled agains the wall here. It seems
to be a storage room. Some lower ranking knights are on their knees
polishing the armor, or helping other knights get into their armor. The
rooms is quite large, so even with all the armor, there is still plenty of
room for people to pass, and to don their armor.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This room is also quite large, but instead of piles of armor, bunk beds
line the walls and are arranged in rows in the middle of the room. This is
probably housing for all of the lower ranks. Many knights who are not on
duty are sleeping at every hour of the day, seeming not to notice the
frequent passing of other knights.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
More bunk beds fill this room, however they are not as tightly packed as
the room to the south. Medals hang on some of the beds. This looks like
the officers quarters. There is a single guard at entrance to the quarters
to the south, and another guard in front of a landing to the west.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This is a small, torchlit landing before a flight of stairs. These
stairs are not wide and made for the passage of troops like the lower
stairs. They curve, following the outside wall of the tower, with a
railing on either side.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This is a larger landing. There are double doors made of oak in the
eastern wall, and two guards stand before them. On the wall opposite the
doors a death lily has been expertly carved into the stone wall of the
tower.

Exits.Description: These doors are made of solid oak and look very sturdy.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
You stand in the north end of a huge meeting hall. The ceiling is high
and vaulted. Tall, thin windows light the room in the day and serve as
arrow slits if needed. There is a torch between each window, to light the
room at night. A huge table fills most of the room, surrounded by four
dozen chairs. There is room behind the chairs to stand, so even more
people can attend the meetings held here.

Exits.Description: These doors are made of solid oak and look very sturdy.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
The south end of the meeting hall looks the same as the north. As you
walk along the table, you see maps of the world laying out. Some of the
places shown you have never even heard of before. A doorway in the west
wall leads to a small room off the main chamber.

rooms.Name: Inside the Eastern Tower of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This is a small chamber attached to the main meeting hall. There is a
desk with a stack of documents on the wall opposite the doorway. Most of
the documents appear to be orders for troop movements. On the north wall
is a case full of small, square compartments, each holding a rolled up
map. In the southeast corner set of very elaborate ceremonial armor, and a
decorative sword hangs on the south wall. From the looks of it, this room
is the working quarters of the commander of the army.

rooms.Name: Into a Thick Forest
rooms.Description:
The trees here are much closer together than before, and are extremely large.
The undergrowth gets thicker to the point of being almost impassible, but
fortunately this is not a problem as a wide path has been cut out already.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
There is a vallenwood with stairs leading up it here, but that's not
what draws your attention. A large plot of land stretching south and west
is filled with tombstones. There are a surprising number all from the same
year... the year of the last great war when Solace was burned by dragons.
The threat this time is much greater, and what shall become of the world,
no one knows.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
This is the entrance to the tree-top town of Solace. There are few buildings
amongst the trunks of the mighty vallenwood trees. Most of the houses and
shops are nestled in the thick branches, high above you. You get dizzy looking
all the way up to the buildings. Around a number of the trees are wide spiral
staircases, allowing access to the upper level.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
Little paths lead here and there between the trees. At the end of one of
the paths is a tall vallenwood. At the base is a welcome mat, and around
the tree is a wooden staircase leading into it's branches. The stairs and
the tree creak a little every time the wind blows.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
There is a small clearing in the vallenwood trees. Sunlight shines
through in the center of the clearing while the rest is shaded by the
branches of the surrounding trees. Children run about playing games. This
looks like their favorite place to play.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
A particularly large vallenwood commands your attention. Wide stairs
lead up to a large building high above. Soft, inviting light shines
through the windows. Near the tree is a big barrel of water, hauled in
from a nearby lake. With the unusually hot summer, the wells have gone dry.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
There are flowers planted all around a vallenwood tree here. A wooden
stairway starts away from the tree, spanning over the ring of flowers. At
the tree the stairway circles around up into the branches where you can
see a little bit of a building.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
The blacksmith building rests here on the ground. It is one of the few
buildings on the ground in the town. During the last great war, when
Solace burned, it was hastily constructed here. It remains mainly out of
convenience. Outside is a small pile of coal. Inside the forge colors
everything red.

rooms.Name: Solace
rooms.Description:
Here a small, shrivelled old lady tends a garden near the tree that
holds her home. The garden is small, just enough to provide food for the
lady. The tree is small, at least compared with the other vallenwoods. The
stairs leading up the tree are small also, just enough for one person to
come or go. Everything around here seems to be made for or imitating the
old lady.

rooms.Name: A Home in Solace
rooms.Description:
It doesn't look like anyone lives here anymore. The fireplace is cold.
There is a layer of dust on the floor. A chipmunk scurries around in the
kitchen. Branches have grown in the way of the windows so that they let in
almost no light. The house has probably been vacant since the last war,
amazingly surviving the fire, unlike its former occupant.

rooms.Name: A Home in Solace
rooms.Description:
This is a cozy little house. One room is a kitchen and living area with
a cooking stove. There are a few tools on the wall, and fresh loaves of
bread on a table cooling. The other room is a bedroom with a small
fireplace. There are three beds and two large chests holding clothes and
mending utensils.

rooms.Name: A Home in Solace
rooms.Description:
This is a small one-room house. A mattress rests in one corner. A small
fireplace provides light and heat. The is a table and chair in the middle
of the room, with a basket of food and a basket of sewing nearby.

rooms.Name: A Home in Solace
rooms.Description:
This is a comfortable home. A couch sits in front of a stone fireplace
in the main room. One side room contains two beds, and another side room
has a table and chairs, cupboards, and a washing basin. There are many
windows, and the house is high enough in the tree that it is lit by
sunlight most of the day.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
You stand near the top of one of the largest vallenwood trees. The open
doorway to a large building is before you. From the doorway you can smell
delicious food and strong ale. This is the famous Inn of the Last Home.
Not just the only place to get a decent meal for a great distance, it is
also one of the best places to get a meal anywhere on the continent.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
The Qualinesti elves are guarding this side of the inn. They are cousins
of the Silvanesti, but it is not a happy family. They are here for
delicate peace negotiations at the request of Tanis Half-Elven, but from
the looks of things they are about to do battle.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
As soon as you enter you are overwhelmed by wonderful smells. Fresh
bread, soup, wine, ale, and Otik's famous spiced potatoes. The bar is
directly north of you. There are surprisingly few people gathered around
it. An unusual drought and other portents of coming problems have scared
people away from traveling and enjoyment.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
The Silvanesti elves are guarding this side of the inn. They are here for
delicate peace negotiations, but from the looks of things they are about
to do battle. There are plenty of chairs and even some wooden booths, but
the elves all stand at attention.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
Light filters in through a diamond shaped window of stained glass and
sparkles off a crystal flask filled with elven wine that is serving as a
paperweight holding down maps. Porthios sits at the table studying the
maps, close to his guards, and as close to his wife and almost-born child
as he can be.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
You stand behind the bar. From here you have access to barrels of ale
and cider, and flasks of wine and spirits. Could there be a better place
to hang out? Suddenly you realize yes, there could be, as the smell of
those famous spiced potatoes wafts in from the kitchen just north of you.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
There are several booths arranges in this part of the inn to make cozy
little meeting places for friends. Normally there would be the chattering
and laughter of many conversations, but today there is only tense silence.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
Here, in a small out of the way area, a spiral staircase leads up to the
second floor of the inn. It is sturdy, being newly rebuilt since the war,
but almost every step creaks from frequent use.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
This is the kitchen of the inn, and one of the best smelling places you
have ever been. On one side is a wide cooking fireplace with hooks for
pots to hang on and iron grates for pans to rest on. On the other side is
a sink that is always full of dishes waiting to be done. In the middle is
a big table for preparing food. There is a batch of spiced potatoes almost
ready to be put over the fire.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
This is the living quarters of Tika and Caramon. For a long time they
lived in their own house, but as they got older and took over running the
inn, they moved here. There is a large bed, larger than you would think
they needed, unless you've seen Caramon. A small table holds many of their
personal items.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
This is the room known as "Raistlin's Room". In their old home Caramon
had a room set aside in case Raistlin, his brother, should turn from his
dark ways and come home. When they moved into the inn, their children, who
were used to having a "Raistlin's Room", gave this room that name. The
name stuck when some visiting mages heard the name and left gifts. All
manner of magical gifts have been left here over time, and whether or not
Raistlin's spirit does reside in this room, there are bound to be strange
effects because of all the magic items stored here.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
This is a simple room, but to a weary traveler it is a great comfort.
There is a bed with sheets cleaned daily, a small wash basin, a chair, and
a small table. There is also a small diamond shaped window.

Exits.Description: This is just a plain wooden door with a latch.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
Here on the second floor are the rooms where guests stay the night. The
floor is covered with red carpet, a contrast to everything else in the inn
which is made of wood. Off this central room are doors leading to the
sleeping quarters.

Exits.Description: This is just a plain wooden door with a latch.
This is just a plain wooden door with a latch.
This is just a plain wooden door with a latch.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
This is a simple room, but to a weary traveler it is a great comfort.
There is a bed with sheets cleaned daily, a small wash basin, a chair, and
a small table. There is also a small diamond shaped window.

Exits.Description: This is just a plain wooden door with a latch.

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Last Home
rooms.Description:
This is a simple room, but to a weary traveler it is a great comfort.
There is a bed with sheets cleaned daily, a small wash basin, a chair, and
a small table. There is also a small diamond shaped window.

Exits.Description: This is just a plain wooden door with a latch.

rooms.Name: Before Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
You stand just outside the Tower of High Sorcery at Waywreth. It is one
of only two remaining towers of high sorcery. The other is in Palanthas,
and is cursed. This tower is the main headquarters of the mages. In
contrast to the horrible forest guarding the tower, the walkway leading up
to it is peaceful and well kept. White stones form a path to the tower
doors. On either side of the path are trimmed hedges and small patches of
flowers. The tower itself is made of gray stone and has many windows
looking out on the walkway.

Exits.Description:
You cannot tell what wood these doors were made from. They have been
magically shaped. The patterns in the wood seem to tell a story, but for
each person who looks at the doors the story is different. Some say it is
your past, some say it is your future, and some say it is just you mind
running away with you. The mages say it is just a door.

rooms.Name: A Room in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
When you enter the tower, you find yourself in a large room with a high
ceiling. The entire room is made of white marble. There are several
benches made of magically formed wood and covered with soft, purple
cushions. Mages of every color, white, red, and black, move about. It
seems that many hallways connect here, although you can only see two. Some
mages come and go by the hallways you can see, but many appear and
disappear when you aren't looking their way. It is very unnerving. A tall,
white-robed mage comes over carrying refreshments. He explains to you that
since the forest let you through to the tower then you must be here for a
reason, so the mages will treat you with respect. But he also warns you
not to wander where you are not invited. On the south wall there is a
small altar dedicated to Solinari.

Exits.Description:
You cannot tell what wood these doors were made from. They have been
magically shaped. The patterns in the wood seem to tell a story, but for
each person who looks at the doors the story is different. Some say it is
your past, some say it is your future, and some say it is just you mind
running away with you. The mages say it is just a door.

rooms.Name: A Library in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
After walking a ways down a hallway you come to a small library. The
room is made of the same stone you saw on the outside of the tower,
however you can't figure out where the marble ended and the stone began.
There are many small tables with high-backed chairs to study at. Long rows
of books extend westward far past where the western wall of the tower
should be. The hallway continues to the southeast, but after what you have
seen here, you wonder if it will come to an end or go on all the way to
the end of the continent.

rooms.Name: A Room in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
As you walk down the hallway your surroundings change from white marble
to dark sandstone, although you can't recall just where the change took
place. You end up in what looks like a meeting room. The hallway forms the
western wall of the room and continues on to the southwest. The room
itself is shaped like a big bubble in the hallway jutting out to the east.
The wall is perfectly smooth and you can see no seems in the sandstone.
There is a circular table in the middle of the room with chairs all around
it, all made of dark stained wood. On the east wall there is a small altar
dedicated to Nuitari.

rooms.Name: A Room in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
A hallway that is definitely far too long to fit in the tower leads you
to this room. Once again the substance of the room is different. This time
it is made of large, gray bricks. The room is just a simple square room
with a spiral stairway made of the same stone leading to the next floor.

rooms.Name: A Room in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
The spiraling stairway opens up into this room on the south wall. Right
above where the stairway connects with the wall is a window. Once again
you are baffled that the inside of the tower does not seem to match up
with he physical space outside the tower. The floor of the room you find
yourself in is made of some kind of polished red rock. It shines brightly
where the light from the window hits. The walls are rough stone pained
dull red. On the north wall there is a small altar dedicated to Lunitari.

rooms.Name: A Room in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
You travel down a long, dark hallway. You feel like you're being watched
the whole way. You arrive in a small square room made of the same stone as
the outside of the tower. A stairway leads up to the next floor. There is
a small shelf of scrolls and a table and chair in the room. Several mages
stand guard at all times. A window in the north wall looks out on Waywreth
forest and the path in front of the tower.

rooms.Name: A Magically Enhanced Room in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room you can feel magic all about you. There are
several mages standing in the room, staring intently at something only
they can see. They chant continually while they make subtle hand
movements. The room is perfectly round except for the doorway you entered
from, and a closed door next to it. The door looks like platinum, and the
rest of the room is made of the same rock as the tower.

Exits.Description:
This door shines like platinum, but when you touch it, it feels like wood.
It must certainly be magically enhanced.

rooms.Name: The Room of The Test
rooms.Description:
This is the room where young magic users come to take The Test. All
magic users must take The Test before they are full fledged mages. It is
forbidden to practice any but the simplest magic if you do not take The
Test and join one of the three orders of mages. No one but those who have
take The Test know what it holds. Those who fail die or are forever
changed. There is someone here right now taking The Test. He is hazy, as if
he is only half here, and he is interacting with something and seems
scared, but the only thing you can see is his shadowy form. The entire
room is so black that you can't tell how far away the walls and ceiling
are, and it looks like you are standing on empty space. The only source of
light is the door, but the light it gives off does not reflect off of
anything.

Exits.Description:
This door shines like platinum, but when you touch it, it feels like wood.
It must certainly be magically enhanced.

rooms.Name: A Large Chamber in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in a very large room at the top of the tower. The
ceiling of the room is made of glass so the full light of all the moons
can shine in. The high level mages perform complicated spells in here. The
stairway at your feet is the only physical entrance to this room.

rooms.Name: A Large Chamber in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
On the floor here is an intricate circle made of colored sands. In the
center of the circle is a swirling blue portal in the floor. The air is
very cool, but it is perfectly still. You try to look past the portal, but
it is difficult to see. There seems to be something looking back. Until
now everything in the tower has been clean, but surprisingly there is a
mouse here, on the edge of the portal.

Exits.Description:
As you look at the portal from near the floor level it seems flat against
the floor. Looking at it from above, however, it looks like it bends down
into the floor. There are swirling streaks of blue in the portal, and
every once in a while a flash of multicolored lightning jumps from one
side of the portal to the other.

rooms.Name: A Large Chamber in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
This is the southeast corner of the large chamber. A mirror hangs on the
south wall. It seems to reflect some light from somewhere, but there is no
image in it. You notice there are runes drawn in ink on the floor before
the mirror and quickly step back.

rooms.Name: A Large Chamber in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
This is the northwest corner of the huge chamber. There is a bookshelf
on the west wall. All of the books look very old. You try to examine the
books, but a shock as you touch one reminds you that it can be very
hazardous to work with magic that is beyond your power.

rooms.Name: A Large Chamber in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
Here at the northern end of the room there is a small, round dais. On
the dais is a podium holding a very large and very old book. A mages stand
reading from the book and casting some kind of spell. Although the whole
ceiling is glass and looks like it would light the entire room evenly,
this area is brighter than the rest of the room.

Exits.Description:
Upon close examination of the northern wall you find an area that doesn't
look right. It is solid to the touch, but as you look at it from different
angles, it looks separate from the rest of the wall, as if it were very far
away. When you try to focus on the far off point where it seems like that
part of the wall is, you catch a glimpse of another room. This could
possibly be a portal to somewhere else.

rooms.Name: A Large Chamber in Waywreth Tower
rooms.Description:
This is the northeast corner of the chamber where the mages perform
powerful magic. There is a large closet here. Through glass in the door
you can see rows and rows of spell components, but when you try to open
the closet a powerful shock numbs your hand.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
The streets become less organized and more winding here. There is a
small park, and the building here are made of normal stone and bricks
instead of large slabs of white stone. The southern wall of the city
curves here, as if it was part of a much smaller, circular wall. This is
the one remaining part of a much smaller Istar from before it became the
center of the continent.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
This part of town is almost deserted. There are very few buildings here.
Taking up most of the north side of the street is the dull back of the
temple. On southern side is the sewer maintenance headquarters and the
street sweeper headquarters.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
The guilds are set up in this part of town. Huge guild halls tower over
the street. The newer the buildings are, the fancier and larger they are,
each guild trying to outdo the last. All around you are the noises of
clanking tools and demanding masters. There are few people on the streets
here, only those who have specific business with a guild come to this area
of the city.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
Now you are getting into the poorer part of the city. The streets are
not so clean, and there are more guards around. Still, everyone lives in a
solid, stone house. This place is close to the wall of the city, and out
of the way, so visitors will not see it.

rooms.Name: The Great Temple of Istar
rooms.Description:
This the largest and most extravagant temple ever known to exist. It is
made entirely of pure white stone, and decorated with gold trim and gems
at every column and doorway. It is a great monument to the gods, but
unfortunately for the people of Istar, it is a greater monument to the
High Priest. He has a statue within, that stands just a hair taller than
the statues of the gods in the courtyard. Even though the gods have a
strong and visible presence in the world, such is the High Priest's
reputation that the population is more in awe of him than the gods.
Everything inside the temple is very expensive and very comfortable.
Velvet cushions cover every chair and bench. The windows are all made of
stained glass and even gems. The rooms are perfumed. The High Priest dines
each night with select guests, and they eat nothing but the best food from
throughout the world off of silver platters.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
As you walk down the street here you see many buildings, all with signs
advertising warm beds and good food. The fancier places are toward the
north, while the cheaper places are toward the south. They all look like
nice places, however the smells from the fancier places are very
appetizing, while those from the cheaper places are mainly alcoholic
beverages.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
People are starting to look at you strangely. There has been peace for a
long time, so you, dressed in battle gear, stand out. Maybe you should
move along and be on your best behavior before someone calls the guards.

rooms.Name: The High Priest's Courtyard
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a large courtyard in front of the temple and High
Priest's home. There are large statues of the gods decorating a very well
kept lawn. Short, wide-branched trees provide shade to several benches.
Stone walkways lead all about the courtyard and through flower gardens.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
There is a small performance area here. Mimes walk around trapped in
invisible boxes. An acting crew is performing on a makeshift wooden stage,
and a bard waits for his turn by the side of the stage. There is a small
crowd having a good time. Most of the people seem happy that the mimes are
stuck in their boxes.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
The streets here are kept very clean. This looks like the rich part of
town. There are huge houses all over, made of white stone. All around are
lush, green lawns. Now and then a horse drawn carriage rolls down the
street past you.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
You find yourself on the streets of a strange city. You ask around and
after several strange looks someone tells you that this is Istar. But that
can't be, Istar was destroyed ages ago in the cataclysm when the gods
punished the people for their arrogance. You must have gone back in time.
It is rumored that such magic is possible, but no one has ever seen it
done before.

rooms.Name: On the Streets of Istar
rooms.Description:
A large market is set up here. Farmers from miles away have come to sell
their products. Each guild in the city has it's own booth to display their
wares. Even the High Priest has a booth where members of the clergy sell
holy water and small emblems of the various gods.

rooms.Name: The Catacombs Below Istar
rooms.Description:
Connected to the sewer system of Istar is a series of rooms connected by
tunnels. It is very dark and very isolated. Here the great wizard,
Fistandantilus lives and performs experiments. Until Raistlin, he was the
most powerful wizard ever to exist. Raistlin was able to gain as much
power as he did because he absorbed some of Fistandantilus' soul to
survive his Test.

rooms.Name: Collision with a Mountain of Fire
rooms.Description:
You try to escape, but you cannot run fast enough to get away from the
punishment the gods have delivered to Istar. Amazingly you are not crushed
or burned to death. At the last moment you are swept out of the world.
However quickly realize you have been chosen for an even worse punishment
as you find yourself falling into the Abyss.

rooms.Name: Stormy Waters
rooms.Description:
Large waves toss you around and a stiff breeze blows in to shore. Black storm
clouds move rapidly along horizon and occasionally tendrils reach out and pass
over you, causing brief moments of sheeting rain. In the distance lightning
plays among the clouds and every once in a while you see a brilliant strike on
the water's surface.

rooms.Name: Stormy Waters
rooms.Description:
Large waves toss you around and a stiff breeze blows in to shore. Black storm
clouds move rapidly along horizon and occasionally tendrils reach out and pass
over you, causing brief moments of sheeting rain. In the distance lightning
plays among the clouds and every once in a while you see a brilliant strike on
the water's surface.

rooms.Name: A Strange Beach
rooms.Description:
The beach ends here, with a tall cliff to the north. The shape of the beach
and the steep rock cliffs give it an unnatural appearance, as if someone very
powerful carved it out of the rock. That and the absence of any life make you
wonder if you should really be here, but you're already here so why not
explore, right?

rooms.Name: A Strange Beach
rooms.Description:
The sand here is very fine and pure white. Holding it in your hand it looks
just like ground glass. The beach looks like it has not been disturbed in
years, there is not a single irregularity in the surface of the sand except
for where you step. You also cannot find any sign of life, not birds, no
plants, no insects. On the east is a sheer cliff, while a much gentler rock
slope leads up and away from the beach to the south. To the north is more
beach, and on the west huge waves roll in and claw their way far up the beach
as if reaching for you.

rooms.Name: A Rocky Slope
rooms.Description:
A steep rock face to the north leads down to a small beach enclosed by
cliffs. You can hear the sounds of the water washing over rocks below you,
but oddly you hear no calls from the birds that you would expect near a
body of water. Although there is a lush field just to the east, there is
no plant life here as the ground all around you is rock.

rooms.Name: Stormy Waters
rooms.Description:
Large waves toss you around and a stiff breeze blows in to shore. Black storm
clouds move rapidly along horizon and occasionally tendrils reach out and pass
over you, causing brief moments of sheeting rain. In the distance lightning
plays among the clouds and every once in a while you see a brilliant strike on
the water's surface.

rooms.Name: A Long Trip With a Short Stop
rooms.Description:
As you stumble around in the darkness at the top of the stairs, you take
a step to find no ground beneath your foot. You try to keep your balance
but can't and fall out into the darkness. After a second it grows bright as
you fall through the cloak of darkness at the top. Although it is little
comfort, you realize for a brief second that you are drifting sideways and
will hit the stairs on the side rather than falling all the way to the
bottom, and then you smash into the stairs, bones breaking wherever you hit
the sharp stone edge of a stair. Fortunately the pain lasts only a split
second as you lose consciousness when your head hits.

rooms.Name: In Chaos' Presence
rooms.Description:
The heat here blisters your skin. There is a rush of air like a blast
furnace that deafens you. It is hard to see because looking anywhere but
down is so bright it's like looking at the sun. The air tastes like iron
and smells like brimstone.

rooms.Name: A Wild Field
rooms.Description:
A dense tangle of foliage has all but erased the old Roman road that
passes through here. A few trees dot the landscape, one growing right out
of the middle of the road. To the north, where the road used to pass
through a mountain range, an avalanche has completely blocked the path.
South of here a body of water wears away at some cliffs, slowly eroding
toward the mountains. To the west a rocky peninsula juts out into the
water. To the east is a Roman city.
